title: Besides Jesus, who has been called the King of Kings? - Quora

response.answer_text: Question: Besides Jesus, who has been called the King of Kings? Answer: Referring to Jesus as King of Kings was not even remotely unique.  Triple H is the King of Kings  The title of King of Kings was first used by the Assyrian king Tukulti-Ninurta I (who reigned between 1233 and 1197 BC) as šar šarrāni. Most famously used by Darius and other rulers of the Achaemenid and Sasanian Empires. In Judaism, Melech Malchei HaMelachim or "the King of Kings of Kings, was used as a name of YHWH, making the title superior to the royal title of the Babylonian and Persian kings referred to in the Bible and learned during the Babylonian Captivity. There are also titles in other cultures, such as the Ethiopian rulers of the Aksumite Kingdoms and the Ethiopian Empire which translate as King of Kings (they even had a Queen of Kings for a female Ruler).  Muammar Mohammed Abu Minyar Gaddafi  Rìgh nan Rìghrean: The red and white husky was the true King of Kings

Besides Jesus, who has been called the King of Kings? G-d, Most likely various emperors throughout history, remember an emperor can have several kingdoms under her/him and some of them may be ruled by people styled as queen/king. Just because some calls him/herself “king of kings,” even if their people call them that, it doesn’t make it so.

I find only 2, but it was a common title for emperors who had multiple kingdoms under their rule Artaxerxes Ezra 7:12Nebuchadrezzar Ezekiel 26:7 Daniel 2:37 YHVH is not called King of Kings in the canonical scriptures, but in in the apocrypha.

The title “King of Kings” is very ancient and was widely used across central and western Asia, northern and eastern Africa, and in some parts of south Asia and southeastern Europe. It absolutely predates Jewish and Christian religious usage, both being western Asian religions using a title that was common in that region and almost certainly influenced by its predominant usage in ancient Persia (now Iran).

Jesus is the only King of Kings. There were other Kings in the Bible, however Jesus is the only one mentioned as King of Kings. Revelation 19:16. If you would enjoy daily encouragement from the Bible Check out my Youtube Channel. have a blessed day!
Alexander the Great; the Achaemenid Kings, the Byzantine Emperors, the Shahanshah’s of the Sasanian Empire, the Shahanshah’s of Iran and Muammar Gadaffi claimed the title in 2008.
